dataModel.name: meriPlanOutcomesAchieved
dataModel.description:
• Fully Achieved = all MERI plan outcome statements were met as planned,
  • Mostly Achieved = at least half of all MERI plan outcome statements were met as planned,
  • Partially Achieved = less than half of all MERI plan outcome statements were met as planned,
  • Not Achieved = none of the MERI plan outcome statements were met as planned.

columns.name: keyAspectsEnabler
constraints: Governance and accountability with well-defined roles and responsibilities
Access to expertise and skilled personnel

columns.name: keyAspectsBarriers
constraints: Inadequate Governance and accountability with well-defined roles and responsibilities
Natural disasters or extreme weather events
Conflicting resource use or economic priorities
Inadequate access to expertise and skilled personnel

columns.name: attachments
columns.description: Please attach any Evidence of Service Delivery here.

columns.name: impactedProjectActivities
constraints: Establishing and Maintaining Pest animal- free enclosures
Undertaking Emergency Interventions to prevent extinction

dataModel.name: yesMaintainOutcomesAchieved
dataModel.description: Detail what formal commitment/s have been made to maintain the project outcomes beyond the date of project completion/life of the grant i.e. ongoing management of the project site. For a project located on public land, describe the commitment of the responsible land manager/s to maintain the project outcomes.

dataModel.name: additionalProjectInformation
dataModel.description: Your contract manager will inform you if there are any program-specific information you need to report.

columns.name: additionalInformationAttachments
columns.description: Please attach any Evidence of Service Delivery here.

columns.name: targetMeasure
columns.description: The output target measure to be adjusted.

items.source:
1.1 To what extent did you achieve the MERI plan outcomes for your project?*
(Fully Achieved = Outcome measure achieved, Mostly Achieved = half or more of the outcome measure achieved, Partially Achieved = Less than half of the outcome measure achieved, Not Achieved = Outcome measure not achieved)
Reflecting on the each of the project outcome statements in your MERI plan, please specifically state what your project achieved, and the degree to which the planned outcome was achieved.

columns.title: Outcome Statement Number
Outcome Statement
What did the project achieve against this outcome statement?
The degree to which the project outcome was achieved

items.preLabel:
1.2 Considered collectively, to what extent were all the MERI plan outcomes achieved for your project?
Please select one of the following statements that most accurately reflects the overall achievement of your project against the outcome statements in your MERI plan.
1.3 If you have any other comments about the achievements against outcomes outlined in your MERI plan, please outline below.

items.source: 1.4 Describe the project’s impact on the investment priorities, and what helped (enabled) or made it difficult (was a barrier) to achieve the outcomes for the investment priorities?*

columns.title: Outcome No.
Outcome
Investment Priority
Achievements for the nominated investment priority/priorities
What key aspects helped (enabled) to achieve the outcomes for the investment priorities?*

items.placeholder: If ‘Other’ was selected, please describe here

columns.title: What key aspects made it difficult (was a barrier) to achieve the outcomes for the investment priorities?*

items.placeholder: If ‘Other’ was selected, please describe here

items.source:
Please provide supporting information (e.g. report, photos), where this has not been previously supplied, as attachments to this report via the ‘Attach Document’ button below, or via the Admin tab > Documents sub-tab of MERIT. Where supporting evidence contains sensitive or confidential information, please send to the departmental Project Manager by email.

Attachments must be less than 20Mb. Acceptable formats include .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .pdf, .docx. If you have videos, please upload to a video sharing service (e.g. YouTube, Vimeo) and provide link/s in an attached document. Do not upload videos directly to MERIT. If in doubt, please contact your contract manager.

columns.title: Attached documents

items.source: 1.5 What were the main impacts of the project? Select up to three program level outcomes*

viewModel.title: Please report each program level outcome as a new row (maximum of three)

columns.title: What program level outcome was impacted?*

items.placeholder: If ‘Other’ was selected, please describe here

columns.title: What project activities had the most significant impact?
Who were the main stakeholders impacted by the project?*

items.placeholder: If ‘Other’ was selected, please describe here

columns.title: Please explain how the project activities impacted the program outcome and how the main stakeholders were impacted

items.preLabel: 1.6 Will you maintain the outcomes achieved by this project after the project has been completed?
1.6.1 If you answered yes, specifically describe how the outcomes will be maintained, including who will be responsible?

columns.title: Activity No.
Activity
Target measure
Total to be delivered (Targets from MERI Plan)
Total delivered (collated from Progress Reports)
columns.helpText: please refer to the Dashboard for your project for this figure.  The dashboard automatically adds the figures from each of your progress reports (as a cumulative figure).

columns.title: Explain why the target measure was not fully delivered or over delivered. (500 characters [approx. 100 words] limit)

viewModel.title: 2.1 Report on and explain any activities that have been under delivered (below target) or over delivered (above target)

items.preLabel: 2.1.1 If you have any other comments about the delivery of the activities outlined in your MERI plan, please outline below.
2.2 Did your project engage with stakeholder groups? (e.g. landholders, the local community, and/or First Nations people, including traditional owners, indigenous organisations/rangers)?

items.title: 2.2.1 If yes, which stakeholder group/s and how? Please report each group as a new row.

columns.title: Stakeholder Group*

items.placeholder: If ‘Other’ was selected, please describe here

columns.title: How did you engage with this group?
Was the engagement planned as part of your project?
If yes, was the engagement conducted as planned?
If the engagement was not conducted as planned, what was different and why?

items.preLabel: 3.1 Were any changes required to the planned project implementation?
3.1.1 If yes, describe any changes to the project implementation and why these were necessary.
3.2 Were there any unexpected or unintended (positive or negative) changes or other outcomes delivered by this project, including environmental, social and economic impacts?

items.title: 3.2.1 If yes, what were they? Please enter each unexpected or unintended change or other outcome as a new row.

columns.title: Type of Change
What were the unexpected or unintended changes or outcomes?
What did they impact?*

items.placeholder: If ‘Other’ was selected, please describe here

items.source: 4.1 Please summarise the lessons learnt in the project delivery. This may include implementation, interventions undertaken, monitoring, evaluation, activity changes and risk management.*

viewModel.title: Please enter each lesson learnt as a new row.

columns.title: Area in which lessons learnt*

items.placeholder: If ‘Other’ was selected, please describe here

columns.title: Describe the lessons learnt
What would you do differently i.e. considering the issues encountered and lessons learned, if you were to repeat the project?

items.preLabel: 5.1 Do you have any additional information regarding the project that you are required to provide?
5.1.1 If yes, please document any additional information relating to the project and attach any supporting documents/images/information.

viewModel.title: Attachments must be less than 20Mb. Acceptable formats include .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .pdf, .docx. If you have videos, please upload to a video sharing service (e.g. YouTube, Vimeo) and provide link/s in an attached document. Do not upload videos directly to MERIT. If in doubt, please contact your contract manager.

columns.title: Attached documents

items.preLabel: 6.1 Do you have a promotional summary (good news story) describing the outcomes your project achieved?

columns.title: Story No.
Good News Story Details

items.title:
6.1.1 If yes, please provide details.
Please report each promotional summary (good news story) in a new row.

This information is intended for potential use by the Department in publicly promoting the program. This can include before and after photos that demonstrate the change achieved by the project. Photos may be attached to the report via attachment to email however please ensure permissions of persons in the photos being attached and used for promotional purposes. Attachments must be less than 20Mb. Acceptable formats include .jpeg, .jpg, .png, .pdf, .docx. If you have videos, please upload to a video sharing service (e.g. YouTube, Vimeo) and provide link/s in an attached document. Do not upload videos directly to MERIT. If in doubt, please contact your contract manager.
